linesOfText.text: For those who protect wild places
and to the snowman that lives
a warning from high in the
the wind blowing through the trees,
and all the sounds of the woods."
Where? Where did the jays say?
asked the Owl of Many Questions.
Follow the snow trail, past the pond
Not far... not far at all."
When? When did the stranger come?"
asked the Owl of Many Questions.
No one passed by my pond."
asked the Owl of Many Questions.
Im much too busy chew-chew-chewing on my antler,"
I will go! I will take the lead."
Ill do it! Ill make a tunnel under the snow
...creeping in closer to get a look.
"I am the strongest and the biggest,"
not knowing what else to say.
on his hat for you and me!
"I can see theres something for you,"
said the buck. "Could it be theres something for me?
My nose is leading me to corn
"I found a treat that I can eat,"
said the young doe as she
Do I have to share it?"
a curious object in the snow.
the animals left by the snow trail one by one
and disappeared into the winter woods.
It was the chickadee who took the last seed and flew away.
The snowman stood alone, but only for a short time.
and the snowman has melted away,
until the frogs start to sing
and the trees grow new leaves."
I think they like carrots the best!
Produced by Carl R. Sams II Photography.
Based on the book Stranger in the Woods
by Carl R. Sams II and Jean Stoick, published in 1999.
App direction, music, voices and video production
Peter Sallinger, Lucy Bowman, Chuck and Cathie Nagorski
